Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 08:42AM stitches wrote: Hello crusader1 :o)  Just found your discussion board, and am happy to see you have such a good response.  I had a bilateral Dec. 18th (no reconstruction) and am doing very well.  Fortunately, the drains came out in one week.  Here in N. Idaho the camisole was provided post-surgery at the hospital and I wear it everyday.  At night I use one of my older ones, step into it, and it protects the wounds while healing from zipper/buttons when sleeping.  It helped to put clothing that I can wear now in an easily accessible drawer, as well as cups/glasses in a low kitchen cupboard.  Beats standing on a chair to reach things!  I hope you will have good support at home - my DH helped me do all kinds of disgusting things, and willingly :o)  Let anyone who offers bring you meals - that is wonderful.  I'm sending prayers for you and all who contribute to this board.  Love, Stitches

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 04:46PM stitches wrote: Hello chemo sisters :o)  I've learned a lot from your posts and so appreciate the input.  Have had second round of six treatments and am also heading into the 'good' time between IVs.  It is SO appreciated!  Am disappointed in all the SEs (32 years ago when having BC chemo, didn't experience so many...but I was much younger).  Don't mind the hair loss - it doesn't make me physically ill.  Grandkids have helped choose some hats, so that has helped with the 'scariness' of having a bald gramma!  My prayers to all of you!  Love from Stitches  (bi-lat mast in Dec)

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2009 09:39AM stitches wrote: Thank you Lena, Deanna and Renrel for your responses to my question, and it gives me hope that there is some help available.  My oncologist/nurse didn't seem too concerned about the swelling, but it's just one more miserable thing - right?  It has been 8 weeks since my last IV treatment and the swelling has gotten some better, but every time I think it is going away the next day it returns.  Will try the B6, and also probably need to talk to my regular physician - maybe a diuretic is needed?  I also gained about 10 pounds during chemo - and have lost only about 3 so far... hmm, thought I would lose weight during the treatments!  Bless you all, and continued good health :o)  Marilyn
